instruction: What machine learning models were used in the study on the diagnosis of lung cancers based on serum samples using ATR-FTIR spectroscopy?
Output: The machine learning models used in the study on the diagnosis of lung cancers based on serum samples using ATR-FTIR spectroscopy were partial least square discriminant analysis (PLS-DA) and back propagation (BP) neural network.

instruction: Can the 2D-SD-IR machine learning protocol based on ATR-FTIR spectroscopy be considered superior to traditional methods for the early diagnosis of lung cancers?
Output: Yes, the 2D-SD-IR machine learning protocol based on ATR-FTIR spectroscopy can be considered superior to traditional methods for the early diagnosis of lung cancers. The study mentioned in the text conducted experiments using serum samples and identified potential FTIR markers of lung cancers. By constructing a two-dimensional second-order derivative spectral feature dataset, including absorbance and wave number shifts of FTIR vibrational peaks, the protocol achieved low time cost-effectiveness and high classification accuracy for early diagnosis. The diagnosis models based on this protocol, such as partial least square discriminant analysis (PLS-DA) and back propagation (BP) neural network, accurately differentiated lung cancers and pathological stages with high sensitivity and specificity, reaching up to 98.7% specificity with the BP model. This demonstrates the advantage of using the 2D-SD-IR machine learning protocol for aiding clinical blood biochemical testing in the early diagnosis of lung cancers.
